article: 10 Simple Fixes for Your Walkie-Talkie Not Working on Apple Watch
intro: Walkie-Talkie is a fun way to voice chat with friends on your Apple Watch without having to make a phone call. Unfortunately, the app is notoriously finicky. If you’re having trouble sending and receiving invites, transmitting or receiving messages, or even accessing the Walkie-Talkie app on your Apple Watch, we’ve found several solutions you can try.

points.name: Make sure you both have Walkie-Talkie enabled.

steps.title: You and your contact may both need to check.
steps.subtitle: If one of you has accidentally disabled the Walkie-Talkie app on your watch, you won’t be able to connect. Here’s how to check:
sub-points: Press the  (under the Digital Crown) to open your Watch’s Control Center.
Scroll down until you see the  symbol. If it’s greyed out, Walkie-Talkie is off. Tap it to enable Walkie-Talkie. The icon will turn yellow and you’ll see a message that says .

If you don’t see the Walkie-Talkie icon at all, you may need to redownload the app. Click the  (the round button on the side of your Watch), locate the   app, and search for the Walkie-Talkie utility.

steps.title: An outdated operating system can cause glitches.
steps.subtitle: You and the person you’re communicating with should both make sure your iPhones and Apple Watches are running the latest OS. At minimum, you’ll both need watchOS 5.3 and iOS 12.4 to use Walkie-Talkie at all. To update your devices:
sub-points: On your , go to . If an update is available, tap  or  and follow the onscreen instructions.

To update your Apple Watch, open the  app on your iPhone and tap the  tab. From there, go to  and download any available updates. You may be prompted to enter your iPhone passcode or your Apple Watch passcode.You can also update directly from your watch by pressing the , then going to . Tap  and follow the on-screen prompts.Your Watch will need to be connected to Wi-Fi if you update this way.
